Broker Interface¶

This is the object that should used to access market data and send signals. This object will be constructed by the Base class (Strategy) and can be accessed via self.broker.

The method signatures does not contain any parameter for the symbol and trading platform. This is because each symbol is treated as an individual Strategy object, In other words, A new Broker object is automatically constructed for each symbol, in the specified trading platform, therefore those values are already stored as an attribute.

class src.broker.Broker¶
__call__()¶

Updates broker attributes (price, position, balance, time). This magic method will be called automatically by the base class before each check, therefore there is no need to call it within the strategy.

buy(typ, qty, limit_price=None)¶

Buy a certain quantity from an asset.

Parameters

  • typ (string) – “LIMIT” or “MARKET”

  • qty (float) – quantity

  • limit_price (float) – Limit price if typ=”LIMIT”

quote_buy(typ, quote_price, limit_price=None)¶

Buy an asset with a quote price (e.g. buy $100 worth of LINK instead of 18 LINK)

Parameters

  • typ (string) – “LIMIT” or “MARKET”

  • quote_price (float) – amount of asset to purchase with the quote price.

:param limit_price” limit price if typ=”LIMIT”

sell(typ, qty, limit_price=None)¶

Sell a certain quantity from an asset.

Parameters

  • typ (string) – “LIMIT” or “MARKET”

  • qty (float) – quantity

  • limit_price – Limit price if typ=”LIMIT”

quote_sell(typ, quote_price, limit_price=None)¶

Sell an asset with a quote price. (e.g. sell $100 worth of LINK instead of 18 LINK)

Parameters

  • typ (string) – “LIMIT” or “MARKET”

  • quote_price (float) – amount of asset to purchase with the quote price.

:param limit_price” limit price if typ=”LIMIT”

cancel(orderId)¶

Cancel an existing open order

Parameters

orderId – the order id which to cancel.

cancel_all(side='all')¶

Cancel every open order

Parameters

side (string) – This can be used to cancel only a specific side (“BUY” or “SELL”, default: “all”)

get_open_orders()¶
Returns

A list of open orders

Return type

list

# Format of open order dictionary:
{
    "orderId": <int>,
    "time": <int>, #timestamp
    "symbol": <str>,
    "side" : <str>,
    "price": <float>,
    "origQty": <float>,
    "filledQty": <float>,
    "status": <str>, # "NEW", "PARTIALLY_FILLED", "REJECTED", "EXPIRED", "PENDING_CANCEL"
    "timeInForce": <str> # Only "GTC" for now.
    "type": <str>, # Only "LIMIT" for now.
}
get_trades()¶
Returns

A list of trades made by this account.

Return type

list

# Format of trade dictionary:
{
    "orderId": <int>,
    "time": <int>, #timestamp
    "symbol": <str>,
    "side" : <str>,
    "price": <float>,
    "qty": <float>,
    "quoteQty": <float>,
    "type": <str>, # "LIMIT", "MARKET"
    "commission": <float>,
    "commissionAsset": <float>
}
get_position()¶
Returns

The position including those that are locked.

# Format of ticker position:
{"full": <float>, "free": <float>, "locked": <float>}

# full: total ammount of asset owned.
# free: amount of asset that can be traded.
# locked: amount of asset that is already in a open order.
get_balance(reserved=True)¶
Returns

The overall balance (quote asset) of the account. This output represents the capital. (“USD”, “USDT”, “EUR” etc.)

# Format of account balance:
{"full": <float>, "free": <float>, "locked": <float>}

# full: total ammount of capital
# free: amount of asset capital that can be used to buy an asset.
# locked: amount of capital that is locked due to a open order (limit buy).
get_ohlc(interval, lookback=1)¶
Parameters

  • interval (string) – candle interval eg. “1h”

  • lookback (int) – how many candles to return

Returns

Previous candles.

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

get_price()¶
Returns

The price of the symbol.

get_time()¶

The output is not equal to datetime.now(), the time returned is the one given by the target brokerage firm.

Returns

The time of the target server.

Return type

datetime.datetime

get_timestamp()¶
The output is same as get_time().timestamp()
The output is not equal to datetime.now().timestamp(), the time returned is the one given by the target brokerage firm.
Returns

The timestamp of the target server.

Return type

int

get_bid()¶
Returns

The best bid in the order book.

Return type

float

get_ask()¶
Returns

The best ask in the order book.

Return type

float

on_trade(side='all', typ='all')¶

Returns True if there was a trade since the last time this function is called, (this is NOT a pure function, if it returns True, the new trade will be stored)

Parameters

  • side (string) – Checks a specific side: ‘BUY’, ‘SELL’, ‘all’ (default).

  • typ (string) – Checks a specific order type: ‘MARKET’, ‘LIMIT’, ‘all’ (default).
